passages.text:
Ah, an outsider. Are you here to take part in the festival?
[[How'd you know I'm an ousider?->Outsider]]
[[I'm just here to fish->Here to fish]]

links.name: How'd you know I'm an ousider?

passages.name: Start

passages.text:
The land knows when strange feet trod upon it. And as I am of Ensomme â€” back as far as the mother of my mother's mother thrice over â€” I am of the land. That, and your face is not one I know.
[[Who are you?->Who]]
passages.name: Outsider

passages.text:
Ah, but even so, you are participating. Ensomme is one with the land and entangled with the sea. Just by walking across our sacred beaches and staring into the bewitching depths of our ocean, you are taking part in our traditions. Iâ€™m sure that you will make efforts to do so in a respectful manner, yes?
[[I won't get in the way->No trouble]]
[[I don't believe in any of that->Dont believe]]

links.name: I won't get in the way
I don't believe in any of that

passages.name: Here to fish

passages.text:
Trouble does not worry me. Only trouble without balence. This land has a way of rebalancing things when our actions go against the divine plans of nature. One moment, it may direct the seaâ€™s wrath towards Ensomme, sending us storms of bitter winds and brackish water. But soon enough, the land will be calm again, and the seaâ€™s spoils will be replenished. We are rewarded for our suffering with posterity. It is the will of the water. So I am not concerned with trouble.
[[Alright then...->Bye]]
passages.name: No trouble

passages.text:
This land cares not for belief. It has a way of rebalancing things when our actions go against the divine plans of nature. One moment, it may direct the seaâ€™s wrath towards Ensomme, sending us storms of bitter winds and brackish water. But soon enough, the land will be calm again, and the seaâ€™s spoils will be replenished. We are rewarded for our suffering with posterity. It is the will of the water.
[[Alright then...->Bye]]
passages.name: Dont believe

passages.text: Respect our land, outsider, and in turn you will be respected.
passages.name: Bye

passages.text:
I am the servant of this land, and the keeper of our traditions. I am the bridge between the sea and the people. I am the messenger that the land has chosen to deliver its sacred messages of purpose.
[[I meant what's your name?->Name]]
[[I don't believe in any of that.->Dont believe]]

links.name: I don't believe in any of that.

passages.name: Who

passages.text:
I have no need for such things. I exist in a world between worlds, a place of spirit and light. I have no need for identity, as I know who I am. I am the ambassador between the mortal and the unknowable. But you may address me as priestess, if you wish.
[[Alright then...->Bye]]
passages.name: Name
